title: Government and Citizenship Basics

vocab.definition: The group of people who make laws and run a country, state, or city
A person who belongs to a country and has rights and responsibilities
A type of government where people vote to choose their leaders
A rule that everyone in a community must follow

teachingNotes: Connect to school rules and classroom government. Discuss voting and decision-making. Use examples from local government.

sample.question: What is one responsibility of being a good citizen?
Who leads your city or town?
Name one way to help your community.
What is government?
expectedAny: group that makes and enforces laws

truefalse.question: In a democracy, people vote to choose their leaders.
Citizens should follow laws to keep communities safe.
Only adults can be good citizens.
Citizens have rights but no responsibilities.
Serving on a jury is a civic duty.
Voting is one way citizens participate.

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of local government?

fillintheblank.question: Citizens have both ____ and ____ in their country.

shortanswer.question: Why do we need laws in our community?
How can kids be good citizens?

expectedAny: what you are allowed vs what you should do
